cards.name: Seedborn Muse
cards.text: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is the wilderness, savage and pure."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

rulings.text: Other effects can prevent a permanent from untapping during an untap step. You do need to look carefully, however, as many effects say that the permanent does not untap during its controller's untap step, and this card's ability occurs during other players' untap steps. If a card does say this, then Seedborn Muse can untap it. But some other abilities are not written this way and can still prevent a card from untapping.
All your permanents untap during each other player's untap step. You have no choice about what untaps.

cards.originalText: Untap all permanents you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.name: Silklash Spider
cards.text:
Reach
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The only thing that flies over the Krosan Forest is the wind.
cards.originalText:
Silklash Spider can block as though it had flying.
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Stream of Life
cards.text: Target player gains X life.
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life.

cards.name: Summer Bloom
cards.text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
cards.flavor: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

cards.originalText: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.

cards.name: Trained Armodon
cards.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

foreignNames.name: 訓練されたアーモドン

cards.name: Tree Monkey
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: The vines and branches of the jungle canopy are all the wings it needs.
cards.originalText: Tree Monkey can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Treetop Bracers
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: Gravity is truly what you make of it.

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block a creature enchanted with this.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Utopia Tree
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: The fruit of this fabled tree takes on the flavor of whatever food you love most.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Verdant Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force's ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token into play under your control.

cards.name: Verduran Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Graceful? Yes. Beautiful? Absolutely. Harmless? Definitely not."
—Fyndhorn elder
cards.originalText: Whenever you play an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Viridian Shaman
cards.text: When Viridian Shaman enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor: She stands as a living symbol of the natural world and an enemy of the forces that threaten it.

foreignNames.name: ヴィリジアンのシャーマン

cards.originalText: When Viridian Shaman comes into play, destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Web
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can block as though it had flying.

cards.name: Weird Harvest
cards.text: Each player may search their library for up to X creature cards, reveal those cards, and put them into their hand. Then each player who searched their library this way shuffles it.
cards.flavor: Krosa's distorted groves bear strange fruit.
cards.originalText: Each player may search his or her library for up to X creature cards, reveal those cards, and put them into his or her hand. Then each player who searched his or her library this way shuffles it.

cards.name: Wood Elves
cards.text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: When Wood Elves comes into play, search your library for a Forest card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Yavimaya Enchantress
cards.text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

foreignNames.name: ヤヴィマヤの女魔術師

cards.originalText: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment in play.

cards.name: Zodiac Monkey
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: It lives mainly on fruit, leaves, and the occasional nose.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.name: Aladdin's Ring
cards.text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"A good lamp will light your way. A good ring will clear it."
—Nervan, royal jeweler
cards.originalText: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Angel's Feather
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a white spell.

If a player casts a white spell, Angel's Feather's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Angel's Feather's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a white spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Beast of Burden
cards.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Though it was built as an instrument of labor, it wasn't long before it became an instrument of war.
cards.originalText: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures in play.

cards.name: Booby Trap
cards.text:
As Booby Trap enters the battlefield, choose an opponent and a card name other than a basic land card name.
The chosen player reveals each card they draw.
When the chosen player draws a card with the chosen name, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

rulings.text: The "if you do" part is only done if you successfully sacrifice this card. In other words, it has to be on the battlefield when the trigger resolves or it does not deal damage.
The choice of which card to name is part of the resolution of the spell or ability which puts Booby Trap onto the battlefield. It can't be countered.
If an effect causes the player to draw multiple cards, each card is revealed as it's drawn. If Booby Trap's ability triggers, it will go on the stack once the card-drawing effect has concluded.
If a single Booby Trap's ability triggers multiple times, then only the first ability to resolve causes Booby Trap to be sacrificed and damage to be dealt.
If Booby Trap's last ability is countered, Booby Trap remains on the battlefield (and no damage is dealt).

cards.originalText:
As Booby Trap comes into play, name a card other than a basic land card and choose an opponent.
The chosen player reveals each card he or she draws.
When the chosen player draws the named card, sacrifice Booby Trap. If you do, Booby Trap deals 10 damage to that player.

cards.name: Bottle Gnomes
cards.text: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Reinforcements . . . or refreshments?
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Bottle Gnomes: You gain 3 life.

cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
cards.flavor:
"Hup, two, three, four,
Dunno how to count no more."

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn't give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

cards.originalText: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play that shares a creature type with it. (For example, if a Goblin Warrior, a Goblin Scout, and a Zombie Goblin are in play, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.name: Dancing Scimitar
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: A blade that has never known sheath, a hilt that has never known hand.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Defense Grid
cards.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
cards.flavor: It lights up the sky, beckoning enemies only to repel them.

rulings.text: The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
In Two-Headed Giant, spells don't cost extra on your own turn.

cards.originalText: During each player's turn, each other player's spells cost {3} more to play.

cards.name: Demon's Horn
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
If a player casts a black spell, Demon's Horn's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon's Horn's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Disrupting Scepter
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: "True power is controlling not only the hearts of your subjects, but their minds as well."

rulings.text: You can use it on yourself.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Play this ability only during your turn.

cards.name: Dragon's Claw
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.
If a player casts a red spell, Dragon's Claw's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon's Claw's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a red spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Fellwar Stone
cards.text: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.
cards.flavor:
"What do you have that I cannot obtain?"
—Mairsil, the Pretender

rulings.text: It only produces one mana even if the land can produce more than one.
This works even if the opponent's lands are tapped. It only checks what kinds of mana can be produced, not if the abilities that produce them are usable right now.
The ability can be activated if the opponent has no lands that produce mana, but the effect will not be able to generate any mana.
The colors of mana are white, blue, black, red, and green. Fellwar Stone can't be tapped for colorless mana, even if a land an opponent controls could produce colorless mana.

Fellwar Stone checks the effects of all mana-producing abilities of lands your opponents control, but it doesn't check their costs. For example, Vivid Crag has the ability "{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color." If an opponent controls Vivid Crag and you control Fellwar Stone, you can tap Fellwar Stone for any color of mana. It doesn't matter whether Vivid Crag has a charge counter on it, and it doesn't matter whether it's untapped.

When determining what colors of mana your opponents' lands could produce, take into account any applicable replacement effects that would apply to those lands' mana abilities (such as Contamination's effect, for example). If there is more than one, consider them in any possible order.

Fellwar Stone doesn't care about any restrictions or riders your opponents' lands (such as Ancient Ziggurat or Hall of the Bandit Lord) put on the mana they produce. It just cares about colors of mana.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add to your mana pool one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

rulings.text: If Howling Mine leaves the battlefield before it resolves, then the last known tap or untap state of the card is used for resolution.
It does not trigger at all if this is tapped at the start of the draw step, and it checks this again on resolution.
The additional draw is separate from any other draw during your draw step. It happens when the triggered ability resolves.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws a card.

cards.name: Icy Manipulator
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: In fire there is the spark of chaos and destruction, the seed of life. In ice there is perfect tranquility, perfect order, and the silence of death.

rulings.text: Once a player announces that they're casting a spell or activating an ability, no player may take other actions until the spell or ability has been paid for. Notably, other players can't try to tap that player's permanents to stop them from paying {T} or to stop them from producing enough mana.

cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Jade Statue
cards.text: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 Golem artifact creature until end of combat. Activate this ability only during combat.
cards.flavor:
"The paradox of jade statues is that their victims never really expect attack, but they are never completely surprised either."
—Kabel, Tolarian archivist

rulings.text: It can only make itself into a creature during combat phases and therefore it is difficult to get Auras placed on it.

A delayed triggered ability that refers to Jade Statue still affects it even if it's no longer a creature. For example, if Jade Statue blocks the Kashi-Tribe Warriors ("Whenever Kashi-Tribe Warriors deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature and it doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step."), the Warriors' effect stops Jade Statue from untapping.
If Jade Statue's ability has been activated, abilities that trigger "at end of combat" will see Jade Statue as an artifact creature.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

If Jade Statue is animated by some other effect, you get an artifact creature with whatever power, toughness, and creature types (if any) are specified by that effect. If you subsequently use Jade Statue's ability during combat, it will become 3/6 and gain the creature type Golem in addition to those creature types until end of combat.

cards.originalText: {2}: Jade Statue becomes a 3/6 artifact creature until end of combat. Play this ability only during combat.

cards.name: Jester's Cap
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Cap: Search target player's library for three cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.
cards.flavor:
"Know your foes' strengths as well as their weaknesses."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi machinist

rulings.text: If the player has less than 3 cards in their library, just exile all the cards that are there.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Jester's Cap: Search target player's library for three cards and remove them from the game. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Kraken's Eye
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.
If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken's Eye's ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken's Eye's ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player plays a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Loxodon Warhammer
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink.
Equip {3}
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0, has trample, and has "Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life."
Equip {3} ({3}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."
—Urza, in his apprenticeship
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk
cards.flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの大男

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.
cards.originalText: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Slate of Ancestry
cards.text: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.
cards.flavor: The pattern of life can be studied like a book, if you know how to read it.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}, Discard your hand: Draw a card for each creature you control.

cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.
cards.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Spellbook onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText: You have no maximum hand size.

cards.name: Storage Matrix
cards.text: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during their untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

rulings.text: This card's ability does not override effects which prevent a permanent from untapping.
Permanents with multiple types untap if any of their types is chosen. For example, an artifact creature untaps if either artifact or creature is chosen.

If another effect limits the number of permanents that untap, that number combines with Storage Matrix's effect. For example, Imi Statue says "players can't untap more than one artifact during their untap steps." If both Imi Statue and an untapped Storage Matrix are on the battlefield, and you choose "artifact," only one artifact untaps.

cards.originalText: As long as Storage Matrix is untapped, each player chooses artifact, creature, or land during his or her untap step. That player can untap only permanents of the chosen type this step.

cards.name: Tanglebloom
cards.text: {1}, {T}: You gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: The bloom contains no seeds. It's meant only to nourish the forest's inhabitants.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in their hand on the bottom of their library in any order, then draws that many cards.

rulings.text: You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

cards.name: Thran Golem
cards.text: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.
cards.flavor: As a beaver's teeth grow unchecked without regular use, so does the golem's armor grow without regular battles.
cards.originalText: As long as Thran Golem is enchanted, it gets +2/+2 and has flying, first strike, and trample.

cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.
cards.flavor: It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Urza's Mine
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.

rulings.text: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

cards.name: Urza's Tower
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {C}{C}{C} instead.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

cards.name: Yavimaya Coast
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add {G} or {U}. Yavimaya Coast deals 1 damage to you.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is part of the second mana ability. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.
Like most lands, each land in this cycle is colorless. The damage dealt to you is dealt by a colorless source.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool. Yavimaya Coast deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Eager Cadet
cards.flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the 'training' I needed."

cards.name: Vengeance
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.
cards.originalText: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Coral Eel
cards.flavor: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

cards.name: Giant Octopus
cards.flavor:
"Before my eyes was a horrible monster, worthy to figure in the legends of the marvellous. . . . Its eight arms, or rather feet, fixed to its head . . . were twice as long as its body, and were twisted like the furies' hair."
—Jules Verne, Twenty Thousand Leagues under the Sea, trans. Lewis

cards.name: Index
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor: "Let's see . . . Mercadia, mercenary, merfolk . . . you know, I really need a better filing system."
cards.originalText: Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Vizzerdrix
cards.flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made that mistake again.

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.
cards.originalText: Goblin Raider can't block.

cards.name: Enormous Baloth
cards.flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.

cards.name: Spined Wurm
cards.flavor:
"I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"
—Wandering mage

cards.name: Angel of Mercy
cards.text:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: A song of life soars over fields of blood.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
When Angel of Mercy comes into play, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Angelic Page
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its bearer.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Ardent Militia
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: Knights fight for honor and mercenaries fight for gold. The militia fights for hearth and home.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause Ardent Militia to tap.

cards.name: Avatar of Hope
cards.text:
If you have 3 or less life, this spell costs {6} less to cast.
Flying
Avatar of Hope can block any number of creatures.

rulings.text: The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {W}{W} to cast it.

cards.originalText:
If you have 3 life or less, Avatar of Hope costs {6} less to play.
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Avatar of Hope may block any number of creatures.

Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aven Cloudchaser enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
When Aven Cloudchaser comes into play, destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Aven Flock
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{W}: Aven Flock gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Just as each added feather steadies the wing, so does the flock grow stronger with each new member.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{W}: Aven Flock gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Blessed Reversal
cards.text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
cards.flavor: Even an enemy is a valuable resource.

rulings.text: The creatures are counted on resolution.

cards.originalText: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.

cards.name: Blinding Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips their next combat phase.
cards.flavor: "Their eyes will shrivel and blacken before faith's true light."

rulings.text: If you are damaged by more than one, the effects are cumulative and you skip multiple combat phases.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Whenever Blinding Angel deals combat damage to a player, that player skips his or her next combat phase.

cards.name: Chastise
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
"Why do we pray to the Ancestor? Because She listens."
—Mystic elder
cards.originalText: Destroy target attacking creature. You gain life equal to its power.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
